title: How to Draw a Calico Cat

steps.headline: On a piece on paper, not a test or any type of schoolwork, draw a circle.
Now draw a larger upside-down kidney bean shape so that the humped part is on the top making a slightly arched back connected to the head shape.
steps.description: This will be the body. You do not want to make it too big because then the cat will look really fat.

steps.headline: Make two vertical lines, very close to each other but not to close, near the front of the body.
steps.description: Make two more vertical lines near the back of the body. These will be the legs. Next these two legs, you want to draw one line near each one of the legs. These are the other legs.

steps.headline: Draw small circles at the bottom of each of the legs.
steps.description: These are the cat's paws. Draw five lines from the bottom of the paw to the middle and some very, very small curved downward triangles for the claws. If you want the claws out, draw the curved triangles.

steps.headline: Draw a slightly curved line from almost top of the body.
steps.description: Draw another line a little bit from the other line. Make sure that this line is curved  so that its tip will match the tip of the other line. This is the tail.

steps.headline: On the top of the head, draw small triangles for the ears.
Draw a circle in the middle of the head.
steps.description: Make points at the edges of the circle and in the middle to make the nose.

steps.headline: Draw two small ovals near the top of the head.
steps.description: Draw small circles inside them. They are the eyes.

steps.headline: Draw a line from the nose down.
steps.description: Do not do it at the chin, but a a little bit more than just about above the chin.

steps.headline: Draw a smile on one side of the line you just made.
steps.description: Do not make it very big. Repeat on the other side of the line. You now have the mouth!

steps.headline: On the body circle, erase it to make it more like a cat body.
Add whiskers above each eyes add three, and on each side of the mouth, add 9 whiskers.
steps.description: Make the whiskers quick, light strokes.

steps.headline: You can now add very light strokes on the whole body except for the eyes and nose, claws if they are out.
Add color!
steps.description: Remember that a calico cat is mostly white. Add orange and black splotches on the cat's body, tail, legs, and every where you don't add fur marks. The eyes can be amber, yellow, blue, or green, but calico cats are most common to having amber eyes. Amber is a yellow brown color.

text: On a piece on paper, not a test or any type of schoolwork, draw a circle. This will be the head. Now draw a larger upside-down kidney bean shape so that the humped part is on the top making a slightly arched back connected to the head shape. This will be the body. You do not want to make it too big because then the cat will look really fat. Make two vertical lines, very close to each other but not to close, near the front of the body. Make two more vertical lines near the back of the body. These will be the legs. Next these two legs, you want to draw one line near each one of the legs. These are the other legs. Draw small circles at the bottom of each of the legs. These are the cat's paws. Draw five lines from the bottom of the paw to the middle and some very, very small curved downward triangles for the claws. If you want the claws out, draw the curved triangles. Draw a slightly curved line from almost top of the body. Draw another line a little bit from the other line. Make sure that this line is curved  so that its tip will match the tip of the other line. This is the tail. On the top of the head, draw small triangles for the ears.  Draw a circle in the middle of the head. Make points at the edges of the circle and in the middle to make the nose. Draw two small ovals near the top of the head. Draw small circles inside them. They are the eyes. Draw a line from the nose down. Do not do it at the chin, but a a little bit more than just about above the chin. Draw a smile on one side of the line you just made. Do not make it very big. Repeat on the other side of the line. You now have the mouth! On the body circle, erase it to make it more like a cat body.  Add whiskers above each eyes add three, and on each side of the mouth, add 9 whiskers. Make the whiskers quick, light strokes. You can now add very light strokes on the whole body except for the eyes and nose, claws if they are out. This will be the fur. Add color! Remember that a calico cat is mostly white. Add orange and black splotches on the cat's body, tail, legs, and every where you don't add fur marks. The eyes can be amber, yellow, blue, or green, but calico cats are most common to having amber eyes. Amber is a yellow brown color.
